Building Guides. A similar app to this but with a modern construction. There are cities, dungeons, ports and more.
Cactus farm
Build an area 11x11 with sand blocks for cacti.
Dig a little trench for a canal, which will automatically put the harvest in the chest.
Hold the "Shift" button and set a serie of hoppers FROM the chest TO the farm.
Close the canal with blocks and plant cacti.
If you any block is very close to cactus, it will be crushed and droped. You should use that. When the second block grows, it will be cut with the serie of planks.

Now you need to collect the droped harvest. Build a fence higher than the planks on the one block. You know, all blocks will be destroyed if they drop on a cactus. So, to prevent your harvest from destroying with cacti, you should move them a little upper.
Cacti are slow plants. To get more profit, you can build extra floor to your farm. I used green blocks to make a border between the floors.

Just repeat building next floors like the fisrt floor except threnches, because everything is collecting with the central spot. The most effective way to have profit is planting 16 cacti on the one floor. 8-10 floors with cacti are enough for everyone.
Here comes the first harvest!
Relay
Relay can cover the redstone line with external signal.
Closed state.
Random generator
Hold the "Shift" button and set a hopper near to an extractor.
Put one stackable thing and one unstackable thing in the extractor.

Bring the signal from a button and set a comparator. Then push the button. The extractor chooses between two blocks which are in it. If there is a stackable thing in the hopper, then there will be a strong signal going through the comparator, so the lamp will be switched on.
However, if the unstackable thing is chosen, then the signal will be very weak.
Double piston
First, set sticky pistons.
Then bring repeaters to the pistons and set delay on the left repeater to 2 and 4 on the right one.
Switched on, pistons hitch each other and the block.
Arrow hit indicator
Set a button on the block.
Bring a redstone road and set a lamp for clarity.
An arrow activates the button on the hit, so the lamp switches on and a signal goes on the redstone road. You can build a shooting gallery. ;)
«NOT»
«NOT» scheme includes a torch on th block.
The scheme changes signal to the opposite.
The button as a lever
Set two pistons and a redstone block between them.
Set the redstone road and red torches above this construction.
Add a button and the redstone road for the output signal.
Pushed button moves the redstone block a switch on/off the output line.
«NOT-AND»
Set two blocks and set two red torches on them.
Provide the redstone and activate it with this construction. Model input signals with two levers.
If only one line is active, there will be an output signal.
There will be no signal with two active lines.
«OR»
This simple and useful scheme includes united redstone lines.
If at least one line is active, there will be an output signal.
«AND»
«AND» scheme includes two blocks with red torches on them and redstone line between these two blocks.
The redstone also goes to another red torch, which inverts the signal.
To activate the output line, you have to activate both input lines.
«NOT-OR»
«NOT-OR» scheme includes two united input lines and an inventor.
Any input signal activates the output line.

Redstone. It drops from redstone ore blocks, when lava appears.
Slimeballs. Drops from slimes, who lives in swamps (can find them in the night) or in dungeons (very rarely).
Nether Quartz Ore. Can be found in The Nether.
Glowstone dust. Can be extracted from glowstone blocks in The Nether. Also drops from witches.
Red torch. Can be crafted with redstone(x1) and a stick.
Repeater. Can be crafted with 3 stone blocks, 2 red torches and redstone(x1).
Piston. Can be crafted with an iron ingot, redstone(x1), 3 planks (any type) and 4 cobblestone blocks.
Sticky piston. Can be crafted with a piston and a slimeball.
Comparator. Can be crafted with 3 stone blocks, 3 red torches and quartz(x1).
Slime block. Can be craftes with 9 slimeballs.
Daylight sensor. Can be crafted with 3 glass blocks, quartz(x3) and 3 wooden slabs (any type).
Quartz. Can be crafted with handling quartz ore in a furnace.
Glowstone block. Can be crafted with glowstone dust(x4).
Lamp. Can be crafted with a glowstone block and redstone(x4).
Redstone block. Can be crafted with redstone dust(x9).
TNT. Can be crafted with 4 sand blocks (any type) and gunpowder(x5).
Hopper. Can be crafted with 5 iron ingots and a chest.

Comparator

Comparator is difficult enough scheme element. It has 2 inputs: back (A) and side (B). It doesn\'t make a signal stronger. It has two modes. Using the first mode it will compare A and B signals, if a red torch is not burning. The singal strength can be founded with formula: Strength = 15 - redstone line\'s length. If A >= B, then the signal goes through the comparator. In other case the signal shall not pass! A formula for the second mode: Output strength = A - B. Let\'s look at the examples.
Signal A = 12 (15 - 3 blocks), B = 12. So the the signal goes through the comparator and switches on both lamps.
Make B = 13. Now B > A, so the signal doesn\'t pass.
The second mode. A = 14, B = 12. The output signal is 14 - 12 = 2, so only the first lamp is switched on.

This mechanism flies endlessly in one direction. It will stop if it stumbles an obstacle.
Set 3 pistons on the ground. One of them should be sticky.
Set slime blocks with redstone blocks on them before the first and the second pistons. Take flint and steel. Click with RMB on the 2nd and the 3rd blocks until the mechanism moving. Done. :)
